Select2 (Normal HTML) #

Select2 Designs #

There are two designs used in "backend" repos.

1- Simple dropdown #

Must add "enabled-select2" class to get this design.

2- Multiple tags dropdown #

Must add "enabled-select2" class and multiple="multiple" attribute to get this design.

HTML #

Example HTML

    <select 
      class="form-control enabled-select2" 
      id="country" 
      data-placeholder="Choose a Country..." 
      data-dropdownparent="true"
      multiple="multiple"
      name="country"
    >
      <option value="1">Afghanistan</option>
      <option value="2">Albania</option>
    </select>

Javascript #

Suggestion: adding only enabled-select2 class to input will enable select2 design, it's not really neccessary to implement with JS. However, if you needs more select2 options with JS, you can use as below.

Example Implimentation


// It's Ok to use both id `#my-selector` or class `.my-selector`.
new UPSelect2('#my-selector', {
  // Select2 js library options
}).init()

It's discouraged to use $('your-selector')select2() directly. Because we implemented all select2 inputs in a single wrapper class UPSelect2 to make it more organized.

Attributes #

AttributeDefaultTypeRequiredAvailable valuesDescription
multiple-StringnomultipleAdding multiple="multiple" attribute will change the select2 to multiple tags design
data-placeholder-StringnoAny textSelect2 placeholder text
data-dropdownparentfalseBooleannotrueWhen select2 is inside bootstrap modal popup, select2 will be hidden because Boostrap modal "z-index" is higher. That's why by adding data-parentdropdown="true" will fix this problem.

ISSUES #

Validation Message Placement #

This is not really an issue. Normally Jquery error message is showing after the input but with select2, it's showing before the select2 input Reference.

To solve this, we can change the errorPlacement for jquery validation as below examples

Example 1

Place <div class="invalid-feedback"></div> after select2 tag or where we want to show it. And add errorElement , errorLabelContainer in Jquery Validation option.

$('#form').validate({
    errorElement : 'div',
    errorLabelContainer: '.invalid-feedback'
})

Example 2 ( Dynamically Change Error Placement )


$('#form').validate({
        errorPlacement: function(error, element) {
        
            // Custom position 1: first name
            if (element.attr("name") == "first_name" ) {
                $(".error1-message").text(error);
            }
            
            // Custom position 2: last name
            else if (element.attr("name") == "last_name" ) {
                $(".error2-message").text(error);
            }
            
            // Default position:
            else {
                 error.append($('.invalid-feedback'));
            }
            
        },
        // the rest rules
 })

Auto Focus #

Normally, when opeing select2 dropdown it should focus the input but it's not working because JQuery 3.*+ and Select2 conflict. Reference

That's why we added focusSelect2AtOpening function. This focusSelect2AtOpening func will have to remove later when Jquery and Select2 has no conflict.

Select2 (Vue 2) #

Vue HTML #

Example Vue HTML

     <select-2 
      placeholder="Placeholder Text"
      :options="data"  
      name="select_name" 
      v-model="selected" 
      multiple=true
      :templateSelection="templateSelection"
      />

<script>
export default{
    data(){
        return {
          data:[
              {id:1,text:"one"},
              {id:2,text:"two"},
              {id:1,text:"three"}
         ],
        }
      },
    methods:{
     templateSelection(data){
       // return formatted data
     }
  }
}
</script>

Props #

PropsDefaultTypeRequiredAvailable valuesDescription
multiplefalseBooleannotrueAdding multiple=true attribute will change the select2 to multiple tags design
placeholder-StringnoAny textSelect2 placeholder text
templateSelection-Functionno-Normally templateSelection is used in formatting data when user select. templateSelection in detail
options[]Arrayno-The (array of objects) data for dropdown options. Make sure the object has id and text. e.g {id:1,text:"one"} (This is not select2 configuration option)
namestringyes-select tag's name [a-zA-Z0-9-_]
v-model-Arrayyes-This is just Vue default 2 ways binding of select tag to grab the selected values.
